keyword: how many calories in a gin and tonic
title: How Many Calories in a Gin and Tonic?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a gin and tonic, including carbs from tonic, total nutrition breakdown, and tweaks for lower calories.
h1: How Many Calories in a Gin and Tonic?
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) gin, 4 oz (118 ml) regular tonic water, no lime or garnishes; ice not included in nutrition.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by gin brand, tonic type, pour sizes, and additions like lime or simple syrup. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard gin and tonic has about 150 kcal, mostly from the tonic's sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add a splash of lime juice (1 tsp)

faqs.q: How many calories in a gin and tonic with diet tonic?
faqs.a: About 110 kcal, as diet tonic has zero sugar.

faqs.q: Where do calories in a gin and tonic come from?
faqs.a: Primarily from the tonic's sugars (~10.5 g); gin adds alcohol calories but no carbs.

faqs.q: Is a gin and tonic low-carb?
faqs.a: Regular version has ~10.5 g carbs; opt for diet tonic to drop to near zero.

faqs.q: How does tonic brand affect calories?
faqs.a: Regular tonic ~40 kcal per 4 oz; diet or zero-sugar versions are ~0-5 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in a gin and tonic?
faqs.a: About 15 mg per serving, mostly from the tonic water.
